text: Ethnos () is the name of a Greek weekly newspaper first published in 1913. ==History== The newspaper was first published in 1913 with a Venizelist political thesis. Always in the progressive political spectrum, it supported later Georgios Papandreou and Center Union. In 1970, during the Greek military junta of 1967-74, it was forced to stop publishing. In 1981, Dimitris Varos relaunched it as a colour tabloid. The newspaper was owned for years by Pegasus Publishing SA.Helex In 2017 was sold to Dimera Media Investments, owned by Ivan Savvidis.Mε €3.580.000 ο Σαββίδης πήρε Εθνος, Εθνος Κυριακής και Ημερησία tovima.gr, 29 Ιουλίου 2017 Dimera reportedly acquired the two Ethnos titles (daily and Sunday editions) for 3 million euros.http://greece.greekreporter.com/2017/07/26/greek-russian-businessman- ivan-savvidis-buys-3-historic-newspapers/ On August 9th 2020 the Sunday edition ceased circulation following the daily edition which stopped circulating on July 31st 2019. ==References== Category:Publications established in 1913 Category:Publications disestablished in 1970 Category:Publications established in 1981 Category:Publications disestablished in 2020 Category:1913 establishments in Greece Category:1970 disestablishments in Greece Category:1981 establishments in Greece Category:2020 disestablishments in Greece Category:Newspapers published in Athens Category:Greek-language newspapers Category:Daily newspapers published in Greece
title: Ethnos (newspaper)
